resources.string: Cars emit carbon dioxide, a very dangerous gas that arise the threat of the global warning. Furthermore, other car pollutants harm human health, with very fine particles that can lodge deep in lungs, where can cause respiratory problems.\n\n Use for some days public transports, your bike or just walk. Is cheaper and healthier!

Did you know that takes at least 450 years for a plastic bottle to totally degrade? And that most of them are not even recycled? Plastic is dangerous for our environment and for the nature. \n\nDo yourself a favor, drink tap water! IS FREE!

Every year, 16 billion paper cups are produced. This means that more than 6 million trees are cut down to produce them. Moreover, Most of them are not recycled or disposed in the correct way by people.\n\nUse your own coffee portable mug, this will help the nature and, since some shops offer discounts if you bring your own mug, you will also save money!

The rubbish in the streets deface our cities and tows. Some sort of rubbish, such as glass or needles, are also dangerous for us and animals. Garbage can also end up in nature and pollute it.\n\n Make a good action, collect some while you walk around your area!

The 70% of the earth\'s surface is water but only the 1% ot this percentage is safe and available to drink. Is estimated that an average European uses 250 litres of water per day and part of it is wasted.\n\nTry to save water while brushing your teeth by closing the tap or have a shower instead of a bath. You can really make a change!

Electricity is mostly generated from fossil fuels and nuclear power stations, which really affect our environment. But a big part of the electricity produced, get wasted by us for our irresponsible usage of it, also resulting in additional costs for our bills.\n\nTurn off unnecessary lights, unplug unused electronics and switch to LED bulbs. Is simple and can have a good influence on our environment (and wallet!).

Cutting trees can result in the loss of animals\' habitats, harming nature and her ecosystems. It also affects our planet with desertification, soil erosion, flooding and increased greenhouse gases in the atmosphere.\n\nBut if you plant one, it will improve our air quality, make your city look better and fight the negative aspects of cutting trees down. Protect your health and the earth. Plant a tree!
